text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bahraini press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- A Bahraini exhibition will be organised in Washington.
- Aluminium Bahrain says ranked as having the lowest operating cost per tonne of all aluminium producers in the world.
- Bahrain is getting international help in setting up a database to help in its fight against unemployment.
- Women make up 21.9 percent of the national workforce in Bahrain.
- Gulf Arab nationals could soon be working freely in each other's countries, in an open, common labour market.
- Output of Aluminium Bahrain to reach 500,000 tonnes by the end of the year.
- Bahraini and U.S. businessmen plan a $30 million tourism project on the island.
- Labour minister says Bahrain spent 45 million dinars on training in 1996.
